content.description: Balancy climbing on very interesting rock. Harder than it looks but very well protected. Climb past 3 bolts to anchor. The long runout between the second and third bolts protects well with a .5 cam.
content.protection: 3 bolts and cams up to 1 inch.
content.location: lower right side of Wavy Wall.

content.description: A mix of slab and face climbing on the long, low-angle, blunt arete that makes up the top edge of the wavy wall where it borders the start of the friction wall. Protects well on mixed gear. Belay from the trees at the top of the ledge. Dries quickly after a rain storm.
content.location: Start at the far right of the Wavy Wall where it turns the corner and becomes the Friction wall.

content.description: High Stakes offers steep and flowy climbing  with big holds and a crux just before the chains. Begin by scrambling up an easy slab to the corner. Stem the gear protected corner, then move left passing a beefy flake. Continue up and left through four bolts traversing the yellow wall to its peak.  Leave your baggage on the ground as the pump builds quick! No pressure though, because the falls are clean and after all... you're just rock climbing!
content.protection: Gear- fingers to .75", four bolts, and a two bolt anchor with lower offs.
content.location: High Stakes climbs the yellow wall above the slabs. To approach, climb any of the Wavy wall routes or Moosejaw's first pitch and build an anchor on the far right side of the large tree covered ledge.

content.description: An obvious, wavy wall that forms a corner at the center of the Main Wall.  The left side is about 50 feet tall, the wall tappers down to about 25 feet tall.  It is defined by its dark grey, wavy, textured face.
